title: Implement Verification Marketplace
description: Claim discovery interface by category/stake/deadline, verification UI with standardized verdict taxonomy (True/Mostly True/Mixed/Misleading/Mostly False/False/Unverifiable), confidence scoring 0.0-1.0 with calibration requirements, claim-specific evidence fields for numeric claims (computed value/method/source snapshot), evidence submission with content hashing of citations, snapshot pointers/retrieval instructions, timestamped/verifier-signed bundles, Merkle root organization, inclusion proofs, verifier staking (min 0.05¢), real-time claim/verification feeds. Background: Connects supply (verifiers) with demand (claims needing verification). Reasoning: Structured evidence taxonomy ensures comprehensive and auditable verdicts; marketplace discovery prevents claim starvation. Justification: Bounty model allows market-determined pricing vs fixed rates; evidence hashing prevents tampering and enables offline verification. Considerations: Merkle organization enables efficient proof generation; snapshots combat link rot; real-time updates maintain engagement; staking prevents spam while being low enough for accessibility.

title: Implement Consensus Engine
description: Configurable voting periods, commit-reveal voting mechanism (verifiers submit commit hashes of verdict/confidence/evidence bundle, reveal payloads later, no live tallies during commit, optional on-chain commit anchoring to prevent equivocation), reputation-weighted majority consensus, bonded dispute resolution (challengers post bonds, escalation increases quorum/reputation thresholds, finality after immutable verdict), automated UTXO-based payouts/penalties, result publication with evidence summaries and falsification criteria. Background: Determines 'truth' through collective verification. Reasoning: Commit-reveal prevents social proof herding; reputation weighting prioritizes expertise; bonded disputes balance appeal rights with abuse prevention. Justification: Deterministic computation enables replayable audits; time-locked UTXOs ensure refund guarantees; anchoring provides timestamp proofs without full on-chain storage. Considerations: Non-reveal penalties prevent gaming; escalation prevents infinite disputes; 'what would change verdict' helps users understand consensus boundaries.

title: Phase 3: Scale
description: API development with auth/rate limits/quotas, performance optimization/SLOs/tracing/error budgets, advanced analytics, first platform integrations, fact cards/claim sponsorship, enterprise SLA tiers with priority routing/settlement. Background: Scales the platform for broader adoption. Reasoning: API enables integrations; analytics provide insights; fact cards drive viral growth. Justification: Enterprise SLAs create revenue streams; performance optimization ensures reliability at scale. Considerations: SLOs prevent degradation; rate limits prevent abuse; sponsorship increases claim coverage.

title: Implement Reputation System
description: Bayesian accuracy tracking with uncertainty bounds for new users, domain-specific expertise categories, complete verification history audit trail, reputation-based stake multipliers and reward boosts, participation decay mechanism, calibration scores measuring confidence accuracy, automated fraud/collusion signals (correlated voting patterns), BRC-100 wallet-native identity with rotatable keys, portable signed reputation attestations, selective disclosure modes, wallet-level independence checks (timing/key reuse/funding correlations), bounded minority-correct bonuses for early accurate outliers. Background: Creates long-term incentives for quality verification. Reasoning: Bayesian updating prevents over-penalizing new participants; domain expertise enables specialized verification markets; decay ensures active participation. Justification: Portable attestations enable cross-platform reputation networks; independence checks detect sophisticated collusion; selective disclosure protects privacy while maintaining accountability. Considerations: Calibration prevents overconfident verifiers from gaming; minority bonuses reward contrarian accuracy without encouraging noise; wallet-native identity leverages BSV's key management.

title: Phase 1.5: Market Safety Validation
description: Incentive simulation for spam/collusion/bribery/herding, seeded gold-set claims for calibration, threat modeling for signing/escrow/payout flows, bonded dispute testing, dry-run of anchored commits/evidence Merkle roots. Background: Validates economic mechanisms before full launch. Reasoning: Prevents catastrophic failures from incentive misalignments. Justification: Gold-set sampling enables accuracy measurement and reputation grounding. Considerations: Simulation tests edge cases; threat modeling identifies attack vectors; dry-runs ensure on-chain integration works.

title: Implement Economic Engine
description: Non-custodial BRC-100 wallet integration for micropayments, UTXO-based escrow and settlement with SPV verification, 2% transparent platform fee, real-time earnings dashboard, integrated exchange withdrawals, bounty model (submitter posts base bounty + optional urgency premium), priority routing for SLA tiers, off-chain payout vouchers/state channels with batched on-chain settlement, time-locked refund UTXOs for unspent bounties. Background: Powers the economic incentives that drive verification quality. Reasoning: Non-custodial design eliminates counterparty risk; batching optimizes blockchain usage; urgency premiums enable differentiated service levels. Justification: SPV proofs enable peer-to-peer settlement verification; vouchers allow instant payouts with deferred settlement; refund locks prevent fund loss from failed consensus. Considerations: Platform fee funds development while remaining competitive; dashboard transparency builds trust; exchange integration enables fiat withdrawal without custodial risk.

title: Phase 1: MVP
description: Establish core TruthMarket functionality including claim submission with structured schema, verification marketplace, commit-reveal consensus engine, Bayesian reputation system, and basic economic engine with BRC-100 wallet integration and SPV proofs. Background: MVP delivers the fundamental value proposition of economically incentivized fact-checking. Reasoning: Focuses on core features that enable the economic flywheel - users submit claims with stakes, verifiers earn micropayments for accurate work, consensus emerges through market mechanisms. Justification: Allows early user adoption and validation of the platform's core thesis before investing in advanced features like AI assistance or enterprise integrations. Considerations: Must implement non-custodial architecture from day one; SPV verification ensures trustless settlement; structured schemas enable deterministic consensus computation.

title: Implement TruthMarket Platform
description: A decentralized, economically-driven fact-verification platform on BSV blockchain. Background: Addresses information crisis by incentivizing accurate fact-checking through micropayments and reputation. Solution transforms verification from cost center to sustainable activity using BSV's SPV, UTXO escrow, and BRC-100 wallets. Goals: Economic truth discovery, incentivized quality verification, distributed trust network, real-time verification, SLA-backed priority, non-custodial architecture. Success metrics: 1000+ daily verifiers, 00+ daily micropayments, >85% accuracy, 5+ API integrations. Reasoning: Builds network effects where each verified claim increases platform value. Competitive differentiation: Economic incentives, real-time speed, decentralized trust, granular reputation, verifiable proofs, interoperability via TMP protocol. Justification: Non-custodial design ensures user fund security; SPV-first architecture enables peer-to-peer verification without trust in indexers.

title: Implement Claim Submission System
description: Rich text editor supporting links/images/citations, structured claim schema with claim type, subject/predicate/object normalization, canonicalization rules for units/timezones/entity IDs, deterministic JSON serialization for hashing/signing/deduplication, time windows, jurisdiction/location, units/measurement definitions, falsifiability checks. Include claim versioning (immutable with new versions linked), deduplication via canonical hash, category selection, source attachment, stake setting (min 0.10¢), deadline setting (24h-7days). Background: Claims are the fundamental unit that verifiers work on. Reasoning: Structured schema transforms subjective claims into machine-verifiable formats, enabling automated consensus and preventing 'true then vs true now' disputes. Justification: Ensures all claims are falsifiable and have clear boundaries, preventing unverifiable opinions from entering the economic system. Considerations: Canonicalization handles international units (metric vs imperial), timezone conversions, entity disambiguation; falsifiability routing sends unverifiable claims to separate workflow; versioning prevents claim manipulation while allowing corrections.

title: Phase 4: Growth
description: AI-assisted verification, expert certification, international expansion, enterprise partnerships, advanced collusion detection, portable reputation adoption. Background: Accelerates growth through advanced features and partnerships. Reasoning: AI improves efficiency; certification builds trust; international expansion increases user base. Justification: Enterprise partnerships provide revenue; advanced detection maintains integrity; portable reputation creates network effects. Considerations: AI must be transparent and auditable; certification requires rigorous standards; international compliance adds complexity.

title: Phase 2: Automation
description: Smart contract integration, automated payouts with batching/vouchers/channels, SPV overlay enhancements for fast proof propagation, mobile responsive design, signed webhook system, API versioning/idempotency, TMP reference implementation and conformance tests. Background: Automates settlement and expands accessibility. Reasoning: Smart contracts reduce manual intervention; SPV enhancements enable real-time verification. Justification: Webhooks enable integrations; TMP ensures interoperability. Considerations: Idempotency prevents double-spends; batching optimizes chain usage; mobile design increases user reach.
